data.description: HAK's "Educational Corner" provides crucial information and awareness resources on GBV

data.title: GBV pocket guide

data.description: Kenya's primary policy guiding the prevention and response to Gender-Based Violence

data.title: Accelerate flip chart
data.description: This flip chart provides an overview of Gender-Based Violence (GBV), child protection, harmful traditional practices, and related human rights frameworks

data.title: Survivor flow chat
data.description: This document is a survivor flow chart that guides the immediate steps and services available to rape survivors. It highlights the importance of seeking post-rape care services within 72 hours to prevent HIV, sexually transmitted infections, and pregnancy. The chart serves as a quick reference tool for timely response and survivor-centered care

data.title: National guidelines on management of sexual violence in kenya
data.description: Kenya's guidelines on sexual violence management promote a multi-sectoral, survivor-centered approach with strict protocols for medical care, forensic evidence collection, and legal procedures
data.file_name: National guidelines on management of sexual violence in kenya

data.title: Sexual offence act
data.description: The Sexual Offences Act of 2006 is a Kenyan law that defines and criminalizes a wide range of sexual offenses, including rape, defilement, sexual assault, and incest. It prescribes severe penalties for these offenses, with sentences varying based on the crime and the victim's age, and includes provisions for the protection of vulnerable witnesses and for forensic evidence collection.

data.title: Find a helpline
data.description: The "find a helpline" link directs domestic violence survivors in Kenya to a variety of specialized organizations offering confidential, and in some cases free, support. These services range from 24/7 tele-counseling and emergency response to legal aid and safe shelters. The resources listed are run by different organizations and government entities, some of which specialize in specific areas, such as child abuse or different types of gender-based violence.

data.title: protection against domestic violence
data.description: Kenya’s Protection Against Domestic Violence Act (2022) protects individuals from physical, sexual, emotional, economic, and psychological abuse, including harmful cultural practices. It allows survivors to seek protection orders and provides penalties for perpetrators who violate them.

data.title: National policy for eradication of FGM
data.description: The Kenyan government's 2019 policy for eradicating female genital mutilation (FGM) combines a legal and human-rights-based framework with collaborative community-level engagement to combat the practice.
data.file_name: National policy for eradication of FGM

data.title: Children act
data.description: This comprehensive legislation governs all matters concerning children in Kenya.
